pull.title: [doc] devtools: Setup ots git integration
pull.body: Document the simple steps on how to set up ots git integration.

events.body: @sipa @jonasschnelli This might be of interest to you

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -144,6 +144,13 @@ Configuring the github-merge tool for the bitcoin repository is done in the foll
     git config githubmerge.testcmd "make -j4 check" (adapt to whatever you want to use for testing)
     git config --global user.signingkey mykeyid (if you want to GPG sign)
 
+Create and verify timestamps of merge commits
+---------------------------------------------
+To create or verify timestamps on the merge commits, download the OpenTimestamps

@@ -144,6 +144,13 @@ Configuring the github-merge tool for the bitcoin repository is done in the foll
     git config githubmerge.testcmd "make -j4 check" (adapt to whatever you want to use for testing)
     git config --global user.signingkey mykeyid (if you want to GPG sign)
 
+Create and verify timestamps of merge commits
+---------------------------------------------
+To create or verify timestamps on the merge commits, download the OpenTimestamps
comments.body:
Yeah, this instruction is a bit misleading: it's not just enough to download that script, you also have to install OpenTimestamps. The easiest way to do that is simply run:

    pip3 install opentimestamps-client
